bitlocker_conversion_status.description: Indicates encryption state of the drive.

file_vault_conversion_status.caption: File Vault Conversion Status
file_vault_conversion_status.description: Indicates encryption state of the drive.

file_vault_protection_status.caption: File Vault Protection Status
file_vault_protection_status.description: Indicates whether File vault protection is active on the machine.

hardware_encryption_status.caption: Hardware Encryption Status
hardware_encryption_status.description:
Indicates that the endpoint storage is encrypted, such as with BitLocker on Windows or FileVault on Mac OS.
It is a boolean value.

wiz_id.caption: Wiz ID
wiz_id.description:
Unique ID assigned by Wiz.It is an alphanumeric value.
For example '000b58bd-554d-5cc9-b114-b58bd518cf79'.
wiz_id.navigator_attribute_description: Unique alphanumeric ID assigned by Wiz, such as '000b58bd-554d-5cc9-b114-b58bd518cf79'.

ad_account_disabled_date.caption: AD Account Disabled Date
ad_account_disabled_date.description: The date when the associated Active Directory (AD) account for the host was disabled.  For example, '2023-01-15' indicates a specific point in time when the account was deactivated.
ad_account_disabled_date.navigator_attribute_description: The ad_account_disabled_date is the date when the Active Directory account for a host, which enables authentication and resource access, was disabled.

aad_device_category.caption: AAD Device Category
aad_device_category.description: Indicates the category of the device, which helps classify its type or purpose within the system. Example values include 'Test E8'.
aad_device_category.navigator_attribute_description: The aad_device_category attribute classifies devices into categories such as "Mobile" or "Desktop" for Azure Active Directory.

aad_system_label.caption: AAD System Label
aad_system_label.description: The label assigned to the system for identification purposes. This field is typically used to categorize or describe the host in a meaningful way. Example: 'Production Server' or 'Test Environment'.
aad_system_label.navigator_attribute_description: The aad_system_label attribute categorizes Azure Active Directory (AAD) resources, such as applications and users, for better organization and management.

ad_last_sync_date.caption: AD Last Sync Date
ad_last_sync_date.description: The date and time when the host's object was last synchronized with the Active Directory domain controller. This field helps administrators monitor synchronization activities and troubleshoot any related issues. Example: '2023-10-01T14:30:00Z'.
ad_last_sync_date.navigator_attribute_description: The ad_last_sync_date indicates the most recent synchronization of the host's object in Active Directory with the domain controller, helping administrators track changes and troubleshoot issues.

aad_id.caption: AAD ID
aad_id.description: The unique identifier assigned to the host in Azure Active Directory. For example, '000138b5-dc2b-4209-8098-7360801c7861'.

aad_device_id.caption: AAD Device ID
aad_device_id.description: Unique identifier assigned to a device within Azure Active Directory (AAD). This identifier enables the system to differentiate between devices and link them to specific user accounts or security policies. Example: '0a9a511d-7f2b-4e78-a346-a47d80c0e982'.
aad_device_id.navigator_attribute_description: The aad_device_id is a unique identifier for a device in Azure Active Directory, such as '0a9a511d-7f2b-4e78-a346-a47d80c0e982', used to associate devices with user accounts and policies.

aad_enrolled_date.caption: AAD Enrolled
aad_enrolled_date.description:
The date when a device was registered with Azure Active Directory (AAD) for management and access control. 
Examples: `2023-01-15`.
aad_enrolled_date.navigator_attribute_description: Date when a device was enrolled in Azure Active Directory (AAD) for management and access control.

aad_created_date.caption: AAD Created
aad_created_date.description:
Date indicating when a device was registered in Azure Active Directory (AAD). This timestamp is crucial for tracking the lifecycle of device management and access control within the Azure environment. 
Example: '2023-01-15'
aad_created_date.navigator_attribute_description: Device entry creation date in Azure Active Directory for management and access control.

aad_device_group_id.caption: Azure AD Device Group ID
aad_device_group_id.description: Azure AD Group ID to which the host belongs to.

aad_device_group_names.caption: Azure AD Device Group Names
aad_device_group_names.description: Azure AD Groups to which the host belongs to.

aad_management_service.caption: AAD Management Service
aad_management_service.description: The management service or mechanism utilized for administering and controlling a host within Azure Active Directory (AAD). Examples include 'MDM' and 'MicrosoftSense'.
aad_management_service.navigator_attribute_description: The aad_management_service refers to the management tool used for administering Azure Active Directory hosts, such as Intune.

aad_deleted_date.caption: AAD Deleted Date
aad_deleted_date.description: The date when the host's object was removed from Azure Active Directory (AAD), indicating that the associated device or system is no longer under management within the Azure environment.
aad_deleted_date.navigator_attribute_description: Date when the host's object was deleted from Azure Active Directory, indicating that the associated device or system is no longer managed in Azure.

aad_operational_status.caption: AAD Operational Status
aad_operational_status.description: Indicates the current operational status of the host within Azure Active Directory (AAD). This field specifies whether the host is functioning as expected, with possible values such as 'Active' or 'Disabled'.

aws_resource_created_date.caption: AWS Resource Created Date
aws_resource_created_date.description: The date and time when a resource was created in the Amazon Web Services (AWS) environment. For example, '2023-01-15'.
aws_resource_created_date.navigator_attribute_description: Date when an AWS resource, such as an EC2 instance or S3 bucket, was created.

aws_instance_launch_date.caption: AWS Instance Launch Date
aws_instance_launch_date.description: The date and time when an EC2 instance was initially launched in the Amazon Web Services (AWS) environment. For example, '2023-01-15'.
aws_instance_launch_date.navigator_attribute_description: The aws_instance_launch_date indicates when an EC2 instance was initially launched in AWS, based on the launchTime attribute.

azure_resource_created_date.caption: Azure Resource Created Date
azure_resource_created_date.description: The date and time when a resource was initially created in the Microsoft Azure cloud platform. For example, '2023-01-15'.
azure_resource_created_date.navigator_attribute_description: Date when a resource was initially created in Microsoft Azure.

qualys_id.caption: Qualys ID
qualys_id.description: Unique identifier assigned to each host by Qualys, used for tracking and managing host-related data. Example: '0a7e6969-e99d-430d-aecc-78d8749438aa'.
qualys_id.navigator_attribute_description: Unique reference number for hosts in Qualys, e.g., '0a7e6969-e99d-430d-aecc-78d8749438aa'.

qualys_tags.caption: Qualys Tags
qualys_tags.description:
A piece of information from qualys that gives more context to a host.Qualys tags are labels or identifiers assigned to assets, vulnerabilities, or other elements within the Qualys vulnerability management platform. They provide a flexible way to categorize and organize items based on various criteria such as location, department, asset type, severity level, or compliance status.
For example '{Internet Facing Assets,Unknown Business Unit,No Asset Group}'.
qualys_tags.navigator_attribute_description: Qualys tags are flexible labels used to categorize assets and vulnerabilities based on criteria like location or compliance, such as '{Internet Facing Assets,Unknown Business Unit,No Asset Group}'.

qualys_asset_id.caption: Qualys Asset ID
qualys_asset_id.description: Unique identifier assigned to each scanned and managed asset within the Qualys Cloud Platform. This ID is used to track and manage information related to the asset, such as its configuration, vulnerabilities, and compliance status. Example: '46307729'.
qualys_asset_id.navigator_attribute_description: Unique identifier for each asset in the Qualys Cloud Platform, such as '46307729', used to track configuration, vulnerabilities, and compliance status.

qualys_detection_method.caption: Qualys Detection Method
qualys_detection_method.description: The method used to identify security vulnerabilities on an asset, categorizing the detection approach employed. For example, 'Qualys Cloud Agent'.
qualys_detection_method.navigator_attribute_description: Method of detection in Qualys categorizes how security issues are identified on assets, such as using the 'Qualys Cloud Agent'.

defender_health_status.caption: Defender Health Status
defender_health_status.description: Indicates the current health status of a host as determined by Microsoft Defender. This status reflects the operational effectiveness and connectivity of Defender on the endpoint. Possible values include Active, NoSensorData, ImpairedCommunication, and Inactive.
defender_health_status.navigator_attribute_description: Host status assigned by Microsoft Defender indicating effectiveness and functionality, with possible values including Active, NoSensorData, ImpairedCommunication, and Inactive.

defender_exposure_level.caption: Defender Exposure Level
defender_exposure_level.description: Exposure level assessed by Microsoft Defender for Endpoint, indicating the potential security risks associated with the endpoint based on its configuration, threat landscape, and other relevant factors. Possible values include Low, Medium, and High.
defender_exposure_level.navigator_attribute_description: Defender exposure level indicates potential security risks of an endpoint based on its configuration and threat landscape, with values of Low, Medium, or Informational.

defender_onboarding_date.caption: Defender Onboarding Date
defender_onboarding_date.description:
The date when a host was first detected or registered in the Microsoft Defender security environment.  
Examples: '2023-01-15'
defender_onboarding_date.navigator_attribute_description: Date when a host was first detected or registered in the Microsoft Defender security environment.

intune_ownership_status.caption: Intune Ownership Status
intune_ownership_status.description: Indicates the ownership category of the device enrolled in the Intune management system. Possible values include 'Company', 'Personal', and 'Unknown'.
intune_ownership_status.navigator_attribute_description: Ownership status of devices in Intune, indicating categories like personal.

mdm_encryption_status.caption: MDM Encryption Status
mdm_encryption_status.description: It likely indicates whether encryption is enabled on devices managed through a Mobile Device Management (MDM) solution.It is a boolean value indicator.
mdm_encryption_status.navigator_attribute_description: Indicates if encryption is enabled on MDM-managed devices, represented as a boolean value.

intune_id.caption: Intune ID
intune_id.description:
Unique identifier assigned to each enrolled host within the Intune management system.
For example '47c8298-24a9-4575-a414-eeb35f205e9d'.
intune_id.navigator_attribute_description: Unique identifier for each enrolled host in Intune, such as '47c8298-24a9-4575-a414-eeb35f205e9d'.

intune_management_service.caption: Intune Management Service
intune_management_service.description:
Service through which the host is managed in MS Intune.
For example 'mdm'.
intune_management_service.navigator_attribute_description: Intune management service is used for host management in MS Intune, such as through MDM.

crowdstrike_modified_date.caption: CrowdStrike Modified Date
crowdstrike_modified_date.description: Host modified time as per CrowdStrike.This field is automatically updated whenever changes are made to the associated object, such as policies, configurations, or detections.
crowdstrike_modified_date.navigator_attribute_description: The crowdstrike_modified_date reflects the automatic update of host modification time whenever changes occur to policies, configurations, or detections.

crowdstrike_last_report_date.caption: CrowdStrike Last Report Date
crowdstrike_last_report_date.description: Most recent date when security report was generated by CrowdStrike for a particular endpoint or system.
crowdstrike_last_report_date.navigator_attribute_description: Most recent date of a security report generated by CrowdStrike for an endpoint or system.

crowdstrike_onboarding_status.caption: CrowdStrike Onboarding Status
crowdstrike_onboarding_status.description: Indicates whether a system or endpoint has been successfully onboarded onto the CrowdStrike platform for endpoint protection. When the value is 'true,' it signifies that the system has been successfully onboarded, while 'false' indicates that it has not.
crowdstrike_onboarding_status.navigator_attribute_description: Indicates if a system is successfully onboarded to CrowdStrike for endpoint protection, with 'true' for onboarded and 'false' for not onboarded.

crowdstrike_connection_ip.caption: CrowdStrike Connection IP
crowdstrike_connection_ip.description:
CS AWS IP the sensor connects to.
For example 192.168.1.231.

crowdstrike_product_type_desc.caption: CrowdStrike Product Type
crowdstrike_product_type_desc.description:
Type of host a sensor is running on.
Possible values are Workstation ,Domain Controller,Desktop,Unknown,Server
crowdstrike_product_type_desc.navigator_attribute_description: Type of host for a sensor includes Workstation, Domain Controller, Desktop, Unknown, and Server.

crowdstrike_operational_state.caption: CrowdStrike Operational State
crowdstrike_operational_state.description: The containment status of the machine within the CrowdStrike environment. Possible values are: normal,containment_pending,contained, and lift_containment_pending.

crowdstrike_provision_state.caption: CrowdStrike Provision State
crowdstrike_provision_state.description:
Status of crowdstrike provisioning in a host.
Possible values are Provisioned,NotProvisioned
crowdstrike_provision_state.navigator_attribute_description: The crowdstrike provisioning status of a host can be either Provisioned or NotProvisioned.

crowdstrike_agent_local_date.caption: CrowdStrike Agent Local Date
crowdstrike_agent_local_date.description: The local time of the crowdstrike sensor. This date reflects the current time according to the time zone settings configured on the endpoint where the CrowdStrike agent is deployed.
crowdstrike_agent_local_date.navigator_attribute_description: The crowdstrike_agent_local_date indicates the local time of the CrowdStrike sensor based on the endpoint's time zone settings.

crowdstrike_device_id.caption: CrowdStrike Device ID
crowdstrike_device_id.description:
Unique identifier for the host in CrowdStrike.This identifier serves as a permanent, globally unique reference for the device, facilitating its identification and tracking across the CrowdStrike environment.
For example '2511c9f8a20axxxa5a6ddf94cd8943'.
crowdstrike_device_id.navigator_attribute_description: Unique identifier for a host in CrowdStrike, like '2511c9f8a20axxxa5a6ddf94cd8943', used for tracking the device.

crowdstrike_customer_id.caption: CrowdStrike Customer ID
crowdstrike_customer_id.description: CrowdStrike customer identification.Unique identifier assigned to each customer or organization utilizing the services of the CrowdStrike.
crowdstrike_customer_id.navigator_attribute_description: Unique identifier for each customer using CrowdStrike services.

crowdstrike_onboarding_date.caption: CrowdStrike Onboarding Date
crowdstrike_onboarding_date.description: Date on which a host was successfully onboarded onto the CrowdStrike platform for endpoint protection.
crowdstrike_onboarding_date.navigator_attribute_description: Date a host was successfully onboarded to the CrowdStrike platform for endpoint protection.

crowdstrike_reboot_date.caption: CrowdStrike Reboot Date
crowdstrike_reboot_date.description: Date when a host managed by CrowdStrike was last rebooted.
crowdstrike_reboot_date.navigator_attribute_description: Date of the last reboot for a CrowdStrike-managed host.

crowdstrike_tags.caption: CrowdStrike Tags
crowdstrike_tags.navigator_attribute_description: CrowdStrike tags are metadata labels used to categorize and identify threats, such as "ransomware" or "phishing."

crowdstrike_external_ip.caption: CrowdStrike External IP
crowdstrike_external_ip.description:
The external IP address of the device seen by crowdstrike.
For example 203.0.113.45.
crowdstrike_external_ip.navigator_attribute_description: External IP address of the device as seen by CrowdStrike, e.g., 203.0.113.45.

crowdstrike_local_ip.caption: CrowdStrike Local IP
crowdstrike_local_ip.description:
IP of the local interface on the device which is used to connect to CrowdStrike servers.
For example 192.168.1.131.
crowdstrike_local_ip.navigator_attribute_description: Local IP address used for connecting to CrowdStrike servers, e.g., 192.168.1.131.

itop_pc_display_name.caption: iTOP PC Display Name
itop_pc_display_name.description:
Name of the host in iTOP PC.This field serves as a user-friendly identifier for the PC, allowing IT administrators and users to easily recognize and refer to the computer within the organization's IT infrastructure.
For example INDABCD001.
itop_pc_display_name.navigator_attribute_description: User-friendly identifier for a PC in iTOP, such as INDABCD001, aiding in recognition by IT administrators and users.

itop_server_location.caption: iTOP Server Location
itop_server_location.description:
Location of server as per iTOP.
For example PAI DC Kochi.
itop_server_location.navigator_attribute_description: Server location in iTOP, e.g., PAI DC Kochi.

wiz_onboarding_status.caption: Wiz Onboarding Status
wiz_onboarding_status.description:
Indicates that the onboarding process for a particular cloud resource within the Wiz platform has been successfully completed.
It is true.
wiz_onboarding_status.navigator_attribute_description: Indicates successful completion of the onboarding process for a cloud resource in the Wiz platform.

wiz_onboarding_date.caption: Wiz Onboarding Date
wiz_onboarding_date.description: Date when a particular cloud resource was initially onboarded or registered within the Wiz platform. This date marks the beginning of the resource's visibility and management within the Wiz.
wiz_onboarding_date.navigator_attribute_description: The wiz_onboarding_date indicates when a cloud resource was first registered in the Wiz platform, marking the start of its visibility and management.

wiz_last_scan_date.caption: Wiz Last Scan Date
wiz_last_scan_date.description: Date when a particular cloud resource was last scanned within the Wiz platform.
wiz_last_scan_date.navigator_attribute_description: Date of the last scan of a cloud resource in the Wiz platform.

wiz_operational_state.caption: Wiz Operational State
wiz_operational_state.description: Reflects the operational state of a cloud resource within the Wiz platform. Represent the current status or condition of the resource, indicating whether it is Active or Inactive.
wiz_operational_state.navigator_attribute_description: Indicates the operational state of a cloud resource in the Wiz platform, which can be either Active or Inactive.

wiz_modified_date.caption: Wiz Modified Date
wiz_modified_date.description: Date when a particular cloud resource was last modified or updated within the Wiz platform.
wiz_modified_date.navigator_attribute_description: Date when a cloud resource was last modified on the Wiz platform.

crowdstrike_zta_sensor_file_deployment_s.caption: Crowdstrike ZTA Sensor File Deployement Status
crowdstrike_zta_sensor_file_deployment_s.description:
Whether or not the data.zta file is deployed on the host.
Possible values are Confirmed,Pending,Not Deployed.

crowdstrike_zta_os_score.caption: Crowdstrike ZTA OS Score
crowdstrike_zta_os_score.description:
A score calculated by Crowdstrike by evaluationg various parameters to evaluate the security posture of an OS within the Zero Trust framework.
It will be a value between 0 and 100.

crowdstrike_zta_overall_score.caption: Crowdstrike ZTA Overall Score
crowdstrike_zta_overall_score.description:
It refers to the comprehensive evaluation of an organization's adherence to Zero Trust principles across these different categories.
It will be a value from 1 to 100.
It is a combination of os signal score and sensor config score.
crowdstrike_zta_overall_score.navigator_attribute_description: The crowdstrike_zta_overall_score, ranging from 1 to 100, evaluates an organization's adherence to Zero Trust principles based on the os signal score and sensor config score.

crowdstrike_zta_sensor_score.caption: Crowdstrike ZTA Sensor Score
crowdstrike_zta_sensor_score.description: Sensor signal score as a value from crowdstrike zta from 1 to 100.

crowdstrike_zta_os_signal_meet_criteria_.caption: Crowdstrike ZTA OS Signal Met
crowdstrike_zta_os_signal_meet_criteria_.description: The assessment items(OS Signals) that meet the required criteria.

crowdstrike_zta_os_signal_meet_criteria_.caption: Crowdstrike ZTA OS Signal Not Met
crowdstrike_zta_os_signal_meet_criteria_.description: The assessment items (OS Signals) that does not meet the required criteria.

crowdstrike_zta_os_signal_meet_criteria_.caption: Crowdstrike ZTA OS Signal Unknown
crowdstrike_zta_os_signal_meet_criteria_.description: The assessment items (OS Signals) that has not been assessed or meet Unknown criterias.

crowdstrike_zta_sensor_signal_meet_crite.caption: Crowdstrike ZTA Sensor Signal Met
crowdstrike_zta_sensor_signal_meet_crite.description: The assessment items (Sensor Signals) that meet the required criteria.

crowdstrike_zta_sensor_signal_meet_crite.caption: Crowdstrike ZTA Sensor Signal Not Met
crowdstrike_zta_sensor_signal_meet_crite.description: The assessment items (Sensor Signals) that does not meet the required criteria.

crowdstrike_zta_sensor_signal_meet_crite.caption: Crowdstrike ZTA Sensor Signal Unknown
crowdstrike_zta_sensor_signal_meet_crite.description: The assessment items (Sensor Signals) that has not been assessed or meet Unknown criterias.

tenable_io_id.caption: Tenable.io ID
tenable_io_id.description: The UUID of the asset in Tenable.io.This value is the unique key for the asset.
tenable_io_id.navigator_attribute_description: The tenable_io_id is the unique UUID key for an asset in Tenable.io.

tenable_io_onboarding_date.caption: Tenable.io Onboarding Date
tenable_io_onboarding_date.description: Indicates the date when the asset was onboarded into the Tenable.io platform. Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Example: '2023-01-15'.
tenable_io_onboarding_date.navigator_attribute_description: Onboarding date of the asset in Tenable.io.

tenable_io_asset_agent_status.caption: Tenable.io Asset Agent Status
tenable_io_asset_agent_status.description: Specifies whether a Nessus agent scan identified the asset.
tenable_io_asset_agent_status.navigator_attribute_description: Indicates if a Nessus agent scan found the asset.

tenable_io_asset_plugin_status.caption: Tenable.io Asset Plugin Status
tenable_io_asset_plugin_status.description: Specifies whether the asset has plugin results associated with it.

tenable_io_asset_updated_at.caption: Tenable.io Asset Updated Date
tenable_io_asset_updated_at.description: The timestamp indicating the last update of the asset record. Example: '2023-10-01T12:34:56Z'.

tenable_io_last_scan_date.caption: Tenable.io Asset Last Scan Date
tenable_io_last_scan_date.description: The date and time when the most recent scan was conducted on the asset. For example, '2023-10-01T14:30:00Z'.
tenable_io_last_scan_date.navigator_attribute_description: The last scan date for the asset indicates when it was last evaluated for vulnerabilities.

tenable_io_last_authenticated_scan_date.caption: Tenable.io Last Authenticated Scan Date
tenable_io_last_authenticated_scan_date.description: The timestamp indicating when the last credentialed scan was performed on the asset. Example: '2023-10-01T12:30:00Z'.
tenable_io_last_authenticated_scan_date.navigator_attribute_description: The last credentialed scan on the asset was performed on a specific date and time.

tenable_io_asset_last_licensed_scan_date.caption: Tenable.io Last Licensed Scan Date
tenable_io_asset_last_licensed_scan_date.description: The time and date of the last scan that identified the asset as licensed. Tenable Vulnerability Management categorizes an asset as licensed if a scan of that asset has returned results from a non-discovery plugin within the last 90 days.
tenable_io_asset_last_licensed_scan_date.navigator_attribute_description: The last scan date that identified the asset as licensed occurs if a non-discovery plugin scan returns results within the last 90 days.

tenable_io_asset_aws_terminated_date.caption: Tenable.io AWS Terminated Date
tenable_io_asset_aws_terminated_date.description: The date and time when the Amazon Web Services (AWS) virtual machine instance associated with the asset was terminated by a user. Example: '2023-10-01T14:30:00Z'.
tenable_io_asset_aws_terminated_date.navigator_attribute_description: The date and time when the AWS virtual machine instance of the asset was terminated.

tenable_io_asset_source_name.caption: Tenable.io Asset Source Name
tenable_io_asset_source_name.description: The name of the entity that reported the asset details. Sources can include sensors, connectors, and API imports.
tenable_io_asset_source_name.navigator_attribute_description: The name of the entity reporting asset details, such as sensors, connectors, or API imports.

tenable_io_asset_license_status.caption: Tenable.io Asset License Status
tenable_io_asset_license_status.description: Indicates whether the asset was licensed at the time of the identified scans.
tenable_io_asset_license_status.navigator_attribute_description: Indicates if the asset was licensed during the identified scans.

tenable_io_ipv4_addresses.caption: Tenable.io IPv4 Address
tenable_io_ipv4_addresses.description: The IPv4 addresses that scans have associated with the asset record.
tenable_io_ipv4_addresses.navigator_attribute_description: The IPv4 addresses linked to the asset record from scans.

tenable_io_ipv6_addresses.caption: Tenable.io IPv6 Address
tenable_io_ipv6_addresses.description: The IPv6 addresses that scans have associated with the asset record.
tenable_io_ipv6_addresses.navigator_attribute_description: IPv6 addresses linked to the asset record from scans.

tenable_io_system_type.caption: Tenable.io System Type
tenable_io_system_type.description: The system types as reported by Plugin ID 54615. Nessus Plugin ID 54615 is associated with the 'System Type Enumeration' plugin. This plugin is designed to determine the type of system based on various characteristics observed during a vulnerability scan.
tenable_io_system_type.navigator_attribute_description: System types reported by Plugin ID 54615, used for identifying system characteristics during vulnerability scans.

tenable_io_agent_uuid.caption: Tenable.io Agent UUID
tenable_io_agent_uuid.description: The UUID of the agent that performed the scan where the vulnerability was found

asset_compliance_scope.caption: Asset Compliance Scope
asset_compliance_scope.description: Specifies the range of compliance requirements applicable to the asset. This field can be customized to include specific checks, such as IP address ranges or asset group tags, based on client needs. For example, "PCI DSS" or "HIPAA". If the Asset Compliance Scope is not available, this field is marked as NULL.
asset_compliance_scope.navigator_attribute_description: Defines the compliance requirements for an asset, such as PCI DSS, and can be customized to include checks like IP address ranges or asset tagging. If the Asset Compliance Scope is not available, this field is marked as NULL.

asset_is_inventoried.caption: Is Inventoried
asset_is_inventoried.description: Indicates whether the asset is recorded in the client's inventory systems, such as a Configuration Management Database (CMDB) or directory service. Possible values are 'true' (asset is inventoried) or 'false' (asset is not inventoried).
asset_is_inventoried.navigator_attribute_description: Indicates if an asset is listed in client inventories like CMDB or directory services.

asset_security_posture.caption: Security Posture Score
asset_security_posture.description: Indicates the security posture of an asset, represented as a score between 0 and 1. This score reflects the effectiveness of security measures in place to protect against potential threats, based on the presence and status of key security controls, such as Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) and Vulnerability Management (VM) tools. For example, a score of 0.0 indicates poor security posture, while a score of 1.0 signifies optimal protection.
asset_security_posture.navigator_attribute_description: The asset security posture is a score from 0 to 1 indicating how well a device is protected against security threats, based on the presence of security controls like EDR and VM tools.

host_meet_security_posture.caption: Host Meet Security Posture
host_meet_security_posture.description: Indicates compliance with the organization's security standards based on the presence of an Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) and Vulnerability Management (VM) agent. A value of 'true' signifies that the host meets the required security measures, while 'false' indicates non-compliance. Example values include 'true' and 'false'.
host_meet_security_posture.navigator_attribute_description: Host security posture indicates compliance with organizational standards, with hosts having EDR and VM agents deemed compliant.

infrastructure_type.caption: Deployment Type
infrastructure_type.description: Indicates the deployment environment of a device, specifying whether it is hosted on a cloud platform (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) or located on-premise within an organization's data center. Examples include 'Cloud' and 'On-Premise'.
infrastructure_type.navigator_attribute_description: Indicates if a device is hosted on a cloud platform (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) or on-premise in a local data center.

threat_count.caption: Active Threat Count
threat_count.description: The number of threats detected on a device. For example, values may include '0' or '1'.

encryption_status.caption: Encryption Status
encryption_status.description: It likely indicates whether encryption is enabled on devices managed through a Mobile Device Management (MDM) solution.It is a boolean value indicator.

unapproved_login_location_status.caption: Unapproved Login Location Status
unapproved_login_location_status.description: Indicates whether a login attempt was made from a location that is not recognized or approved for the user.

full_disk_encryption_status.caption: Full Disk Encryption Status
full_disk_encryption_status.description: Indicates whether the full disk encryption is enabled (true) or not enabled (false) on the host. It is a boolean value indicator. Populated from MS Intune MDM Encryption status attribute. Distinct values are true and false.

cmdb_last_sync_date.caption: CMDB Last Sync Date
cmdb_last_sync_date.description: The most recent date when the host's data was successfully synchronized with the CMDB.

cmdb_last_sync_status.caption: CMDB Last Sync Status
cmdb_last_sync_status.description: Indicates whether the last attempt to sync the host's data with the CMDB was successful or not. Populated from last report date from ITOP PC.

naming_convention_compliance_status.caption: Naming Convention Compliance Status
naming_convention_compliance_status.description: Indicates whether the host name complies with the organization's defined naming standards.

vm_scan_sla_breach_status.caption: VM Scan SLA Breach Status
vm_scan_sla_breach_status.description: Indicates whether a host has missed its scheduled vulnerability scan within the defined SLA timeframe or not.

vm_scan_sla_breach_duration.caption: VM Scan SLA Breach Duration
vm_scan_sla_breach_duration.description: Specifies the defined time interval within which a host must complete its scheduled vulnerability management scan.

vm_scan_sla_duration.caption: VM Scan SLA Duration
vm_scan_sla_duration.description: Specifies the defined time interval within which a host must complete its scheduled vulnerability management scan.

ad_uac_compliance_status.caption: AD UAC Compliance Status
ad_uac_compliance_status.description: Indicates whether the host's Active Directory User Account Control (UAC) settings comply with security requirements or are in a secure state. Determines if an account is securely configured by allowing valid user or machine types without insecure flags like disabled status for active machines, no password, delegation, or non-expiring passwords.

eol_status.caption: End of Life Status
eol_status.description: End of Life status refers to the point at which a hardware or software product is no longer supported by the manufacturer or vendor. Once a product reaches EOL, it stops receiving critical updates such as security patches, bug fixes, or technical support.

eol_date.caption: End of Life Date
eol_date.description: The End of Life Date is the official date when a hardware or software product reaches the end of its lifecycle, as declared by the vendor or manufacturer.

normalized_os.caption: Normalized OS
normalized_os.description: Normalized OS generated through DS job

compliance_state.caption: Compliance State
compliance_state.description: Indicates the compliance status of a device within a Mobile Device Management (MDM) system, reflecting adherence to established policies and rules. Possible values include 'compliant', 'inGracePeriod', 'non-compliant', and 'Config Manager'.

environment.caption: Environment
environment.description: Tag that defines the environment in which cloud resources are deployed and used.Values typically include dev,staging,prod etc.

has_admin_privileges.caption: Has Admin Privileges
has_admin_privileges.description: This property indicated whether this VM is has admin Privilage.Admin permissions are defined as permissions that can allow an attacker persistence in the environment. These can be IAM permissions to provision, create, delete, or update identities or wild card permissions on the subscription/account/project level.

has_high_privileges.caption: Has High Privileges
has_high_privileges.description: This property indicated whether this VM has high privilege.High permissions are derived from workflow disruption - permissions that allow the deletion of resources that might disrupt the workflow.

has_sensitive_data.caption: Has Sensitive Info
has_sensitive_data.description: This property indicates whether the VM has sensitive data contained within

scaling_group_name.caption: Scaling Group Name
scaling_group_name.description: Unique name associated with the scaling group. This name must be unique per Region per account.

azure_vm_disable_password_authentication.caption: Azure VM Password Auth Disabled
azure_vm_disable_password_authentication.description: Azure Configuration option determining whether password authentication for VM access is allowed. If the field value is set to true, the VM uses an alternative method, such as SSH key pairs. The possible distinct values are 'True' and 'False'.

wiz_is_cloud_managed.caption: Is Managed by Cloud As Per Wiz
wiz_is_cloud_managed.description: This property indicated whether this VM was launched by a service. This includes: Azure Scale Sets, GCP Instance Groups, and any AWS VM with a non-empty requested ID (for example, AWS Management Console, Auto Scaling, and so on).

jailbroken.caption: Jailbroken
jailbroken.description: Indicates whether the device is jailbroken or rooted, meaning it has elevated access that bypasses standard operating system security controls.

crowdstrike_last_report_sla_duration.caption: Crowdstrike Last Report SLA Duration
crowdstrike_last_report_sla_duration.description: Represents the number of days since the asset last reported to CrowdStrike

crowdstrike_last_report_sla_status.caption: Crowdstrike Last Report SLA Status
crowdstrike_last_report_sla_status.description: Represents whether the asset last reported to CrowdStrike within the last 7 days

aad_management_status.caption: AAD Management Status
aad_management_status.description: Management status of the entity in AAD

mdm_sync_delay_status.caption: MDM Sync Delay Status
mdm_sync_delay_status.description: MDM Sync Delay Status refers to the current state or metric indicating whether there is a delay in synchronizing data between the Mobile Device Management (MDM) system and managed devices.

edr_cloud_reporting_sla_breach_status.caption: EDR Cloud Reporting SLA Breach Status
edr_cloud_reporting_sla_breach_status.description: Indicates whether the Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) solution has failed to report telemetry data to the cloud within the defined Service Level Agreement (SLA) timeframe. A breach suggests potential visibility gaps or communication issues with the endpoint.

edr_cloud_reporting_sla_duration.caption: EDR Cloud Report Elapsed Days
edr_cloud_reporting_sla_duration.description: Indicates the maximum allowable time within which an EDR must report telemetry data to the cloud, as per the Service Level Agreement (SLA).

rapid7_last_history_date.caption: Rapid7 Last History Date
rapid7_last_history_date.description: Last updated date of the asset

rapid7_first_history_date.caption: Rapid7 First History Date
rapid7_first_history_date.description: First updated date of the asset

rapid7_hostnames.caption: Rapid7 Hostname
rapid7_hostnames.description: The primary host name (local or FQDN) of the asset.

rapid7_os_family_classification.caption: Rapid7 OS Family Classification
rapid7_os_family_classification.description: The family of the operating system.

rapid7_scan_type.caption: Rapid7 Scan Type
rapid7_scan_type.description: The source of the unique identifier.

rapid7_scan_template.caption: Rapid7 Scan Template
rapid7_scan_template.description: The identifier of the scan template configured in the site.

rapid7_asset_group_id.caption: Rapid7 Asset Group ID
rapid7_asset_group_id.description: The identifier of the asset group.

rapid7_asset_group_name.caption: Rapid7 Asset Group Name
rapid7_asset_group_name.description: The name of the asset group.

tanium_hostname.caption: Tanium Hostname
tanium_hostname.description: The assigned name of the endpoint as per Tanium

tanium_computer_id.caption: Tanium Computer ID
tanium_computer_id.description: The Tanium Client computer ID. This is temporally unique but not stable.

tanium_first_seen.caption: Tanium First Seen
tanium_first_seen.description: The datetime an endpoint was first seen as per Tanium.

tanium_last_seen.caption: Tanium Last Seen
tanium_last_seen.description: The datetime an endpoint was last seen as per Tanium.

tanium_id.caption: Tanium ID
tanium_id.description: The unique ID as per Tanium.

tanium_onboarding_status.caption: Tanium Onboarding Status
tanium_onboarding_status.description: Indicates whether the host is covered by Tanium.

tanium_system_uuid.caption: Tanium System UUID
tanium_system_uuid.description: The UUID of the endpoint hardware. Note that this has no real guarantee of uniqueness across platforms and a strong possibility of duplicates within platforms (for virtual endpoints in particular).

tanium_ip_addresses.caption: Tanium IP Addresses
tanium_ip_addresses.description: The current IP addresses of this endpoint according to tanium.

tanium_nat_ip_address.caption: Tanium NAT IP Address
tanium_nat_ip_address.description: The IP Address of this client as seen from the Tanium Server.

tanium_chassis_type.caption: Tanium Chassis Type
tanium_chassis_type.description: The machine or chassis type of the endpoint as of Tanium.

tanium_last_scan_date.caption: Tanium Last Scan Date
tanium_last_scan_date.description: Date when a vulnerability scan was last done by Tanium.

tanium_operating_system_generation.caption: Tanium Operating System Generation
tanium_operating_system_generation.description: Operating System Generation as in Tanium.

asset_criticality.caption: Asset Criticality
asset_criticality.description: Defines the importance of an asset based on its business impact, sensitivity and  helping prioritize exposure mitigation.
asset_criticality.navigator_attribute_description: Criticality indicates how vital a host or device is within a network infrastructure, measuring the potential impact of a successful attack with values ranging from Critical (most severe) to Low (least severe). This field is derived from Criticality Score as : Critical (750-1000), High (500-749), Medium (250-499), Low (0-249).

asset_criticality_score.caption: Asset Criticality Score
asset_criticality_score.description: Asset Criticality Score (out of 1000) used to determine an asset criticality based on its business impact and sensitivity. This score helps categorize assets into different criticality levels, aiding in risk assessment and exposure mitigation.
asset_criticality_score.navigator_attribute_description: Criticality_score is a quantitative measure between 0-1000 that assesses a host's importance based on its attack surface, where higher scores indicate devices with greater security significance and potential impact if compromised.

exposure_score.caption: Exposure Score
exposure_score.description: Represents the weighted average of an asset Exposure Scores, indicating its overall risk based on associated findings.
exposure_score.navigator_attribute_description: Exposure_score is a numerical value from 0-1000 that quantifies a host device's accessibility to potential threats, where higher scores indicate greater risk. This metric tracks both active and inactive hosts, maintaining scores even after hosts are deactivated, enabling security teams to identify inactive hosts that still retain exposure levels requiring remediation

exposure_severity.caption: Exposure Severity
exposure_severity.description: Classifies assets from Critical to Low based on asset impact and the likelihood of exploitation, aiding in risk prioritization and remediation

This field is derived from Exposure Score as : Critical (750-1000), High (500-749), Medium (250-499), Low (0-249).

wiz_subscription_id.description: This is a unique identifier assigned by Wiz for a Subscription External ID

wiz_kubernetes_namespace_external_Id.description: The ID given to the cluster resources that are divided between multiple users, teams, or projects.

wiz_kubernetes_node_external_Id.description: It is a unique identifier assigned to each node in the Kubernetes cluster.

wiz_kubernetes_pod_external_Id.caption: Kubernetes Pod External ID
wiz_kubernetes_pod_external_Id.description: Each pod is identified by its unique name within its namespace

wiz_kubernetes_cluster_external_Id.description: A unique identifier associated with a Kubernetes cluster in certain contexts or systems that integrate with Kubernetes.

wiz_kubernetes_cluster_name.description: The name assigned to a Kubernetes cluster within the Kubernetes ecosystem.

wiz_memory_gb.caption: Memory (in GB)
wiz_memory_gb.description: The memory allocated to the resource (in GB)

wiz_total_disks.caption: Total Disks
wiz_total_disks.description: Number of disks used/allottted to the resoure

wiz_virtual_cpus.caption: Virtual CPUs
wiz_virtual_cpus.description: Number of Virtual CPUs used/allottted to the resoure

wiz_projects.caption: Wiz Projects
wiz_projects.description: The project information associated with the resource.

wiz_active_services.caption: Active Services as per Wiz
wiz_active_services.description: Refers to active services running in the host.

wiz_is_container_host.caption: Is Container Host as per Wiz
wiz_is_container_host.description: Indicates that this resource is used to host containers in managed Kubernetes clusters.

wiz_is_container_host_scanned.caption: Is Container Host scanned as per Wiz
wiz_is_container_host_scanned.description: Indicated whether the container host was scanned by Wiz

wiz_is_container_cluster_connected.caption: Is Container Cluster Connected as per Wiz
wiz_is_container_cluster_connected.description: Indicates whether the cluster running the container is connected to Wiz for effective analysis of the container network and identity.

wiz_is_scanned_from_non_os_disk.caption: Is Scanned from Non-OS Disk as per Wiz
wiz_is_scanned_from_non_os_disk.description: Indicates whether Wiz scanned the container from a non-os disk

wiz_is_default_security_context.caption: Is Default Security Context as per Wiz
wiz_is_default_security_context.description: A Security Context defines privilege and access control settings for a Pod or a Container (e.g., privileged mode, read/write permissions to filesystem, etc.). If the flag is set, the Pod or Container security context wasn't altered by the user, so it fallbacks on the default configuration for the given environment.

wiz_is_ephemeral.caption: Is Ephemeral as per Wiz
wiz_is_ephemeral.description: This property indicates when a resource is ephemeral.

wiz_is_serverless_container.caption: Is Serverless Container
wiz_is_serverless_container.description: This property indicated whether this VM is a server less container.

wiz_password_authentication_disabled.caption: Is Password Authentication Disabled as per Wiz
wiz_password_authentication_disabled.description: Indicates whether the password authentication is disabled or not.

wiz_has_admin_privileges.caption: Has Admin Privileges as per Wiz
wiz_has_admin_privileges.description: This property indicated whether this VM is has admin Privilage.

wiz_has_high_privileges.caption: Has High Privileges as per Wiz
wiz_has_high_privileges.description: This property indicated whether this VM has high privilage.

wiz_has_sensitive_data.caption: Has Sensitive Data as per Wiz
wiz_has_sensitive_data.description: This property indicated whether this VM has sensitive data.

wiz_number_of_addresses_open_for_http.caption: Number of Addresses Open for HTTP as per Wiz
wiz_number_of_addresses_open_for_http.description: Number of external IP addresses that have access to the resource on non-standard ports, which includes all ports except 80 (HTTP), 443 (HTTPS), 22 (SSH), 3389 (RDP), 5985 (WINRM) and 5986 (WINRM).

wiz_number_of_addresses_open_for_https.caption: Number of Addresses Open for HTTPS as per Wiz
wiz_number_of_addresses_open_for_https.description: Number of external IP addresses that have access to the resource on port 443.

wiz_number_of_addresses_open_for_non_sta.caption: Number of Addresses Open for Non Standard Ports as per Wiz
wiz_number_of_addresses_open_for_non_sta.description: Number of external IP addresses that have access to the resource on non standard ports.

wiz_number_of_addresses_open_for_rdp.caption: Number of Addresses Open for RDP as per Wiz
wiz_number_of_addresses_open_for_rdp.description: Number of external IP addresses that have access to the resource on port 3389 (RDP).

wiz_number_of_addresses_open_for_ssh.caption: Number of Addresses Open for SSH as per Wiz
wiz_number_of_addresses_open_for_ssh.description: Number of external IP addresses that have access to the resource on port 22 (SSH).

wiz_number_of_addresses_open_for_winrm.caption: Number of Addresses Open for WINRM as per Wiz
wiz_number_of_addresses_open_for_winrm.description: Number of external IP addresses that have access to the resource on port 5985/5986 (WINRM).

wiz_open_to_all_internet.caption: Open to All Internet as per Wiz
wiz_open_to_all_internet.description:
Indicates whether this resource is accessible from the public internet.
Wiz effective exposure analysis is based on the Wiz graph network algorithm analyzing ports, protocols, IPs, security groups, peering, and configs to determine network reachability.

wiz_created_at.caption: Created at in Cloud as per Wiz
wiz_created_at.description: Date on which the resource was created in the cloud platform.

wiz_is_accessible_from_internet.caption: Internet Exposure as per Wiz
wiz_is_accessible_from_internet.description:
Indicates whether this resource is accessible from at least one internet address.
Wiz effective exposure analysis is based on the Wiz graph network algorithm analyzing ports, protocols, IPs, security groups, peering, and configs to determine network reachability.

wiz_security_context_privileged.caption: Is Security Context Privileged as per Wiz
wiz_security_context_privileged.description: Indicates whether the host has privilege as per Wiz security context.

wiz_security_context_runs_as_root.caption: Is Security Context Runs as Root as per Wiz
wiz_security_context_runs_as_root.description: Indicates whether the host runs as root as per Wiz security context.

wiz_resource_type.description: Cloud resource type as per Wiz.

tenable_io_last_licensed_scan_date.caption: Tenable.io Last Licensed Scan Date
tenable_io_last_licensed_scan_date.description: The time and date of the last scan that identified the asset as licensed. Tenable.io categorizes an asset as licensed if a scan of that asset has returned results from a non-discovery plugin within the last 90 days.

tenable_io_source_name.caption: Tenable.io Source Name
tenable_io_source_name.description:
The sources of the scans that identified the asset. An asset source is the entity that reported the asset details. Sources can include sensors, connectors, and API imports. If your request specifies multiple sources, Tenable.io returns all assets seen by any of the specified sources.

The items in the sources array must correspond to the names of the sources as defined in your organization's implementation of Tenable.io.

tenable_io_license_status.caption: Tenable.io License Status
tenable_io_license_status.description: The Tenable.io License Status is determined by checking if there has been a scan within the last 90 days that identified the asset as licensed. If the last scan date is not null (indicating a recent scan), the status is set to 'true', otherwise 'false'.

tenable_io_active_services.caption: Tenable.io Active Services
tenable_io_active_services.description: Services running on the asset determined by Tenable.io.

tenable_io_hostnames.caption: Tenable.io Hostnames
tenable_io_hostnames.description: The hostnames that Tenable.io scans have associated with the asset record.

tenable_io_agent_names.caption: Tenable.io Agent Names
tenable_io_agent_names.description: The names of any Nessus agents (Tenable.io Agents) that scanned and identified the asset.

tenable_io_operating_systems.caption: Tenable.io Operating Systems
tenable_io_operating_systems.description: The operating systems that Tenable.io scans have associated with the asset record.

tenable_io_created_at.caption: Tenable.io Created At
tenable_io_created_at.description: The time and date when Tenable.io created the asset record.

tenable_io_first_seen_date.caption: Tenable.io First Seen Date
tenable_io_first_seen_date.description: The time and date when a Tenable.io scan first identified the asset.

tenable_io_first_scan_date.caption: Tenable.io First Scan Date
tenable_io_first_scan_date.description: The date of the first Tenable.io scan run against the asset.

tenable_io_fqdns.caption: Tenable.io FQDNs
tenable_io_fqdns.description: The FQDNs that Tenable.io scans have associated with the asset record.

tenable_io_mac_address.caption: Tenable.io MAC Addresses
tenable_io_mac_address.description: The MAC addresses that Tenable.io scans have associated with the asset record.

itop_user_organization.description: Organization to which the Person belongs as of iTOPO.

itop_user_status.description: The user status of the entity as of iTOP.

rapid7_asset_group_country_code.caption: Rapid7 Asset Group Country Code
rapid7_asset_group_country_code.description: The country code extracted from the Rapid7 asset group name.

asset_visibility.caption: Asset Visibility
asset_visibility.description: Determines whether the host asset is reachable from the Internet (External) or is only accessible from their internal network (Internal). In some cases, it may not be possible to determine this, in which case it would be assigned the value Unknown.

asset_environment.caption: Asset Environment
asset_environment.description: The environment in which the asset exists in. Depending on the clients architecture, it may be necessary to extend the values that can be assigned.

asset_purpose_rating.caption: Asset Purpose Rating
asset_purpose_rating.description: Asset Purpose Rating is a numeric score ranging from 0 to 1 based on the purpose of the asset.

zta_compliance.caption: ZTA RAG Compliance
zta_compliance.description: It refers to aligning an organization's security practices, policies, and infrastructure with the principles of Zero Trust Architecture.

host_meet_zta_compliance.caption: ZTA Compliant
host_meet_zta_compliance.description: Indicates whether ZTA score is above 95.

host_zta_reporting_status.caption: Host ZTA Reporting Status
host_zta_reporting_status.description: Indicates what the ZTA Reporting Status is.

is_domain_joined.caption: Is Domain Joined
is_domain_joined.description: Indicates whether the host is joined to domain or not.

is_hostname_convention_compliant.caption: Is Hostname Convention Compliant
is_hostname_convention_compliant.description: Indicates whether the hostname conforms to the TP Global Naming Convention.

hostname_prefix_country.caption: Hostname Prefix Country
hostname_prefix_country.description: Country inferred from first two letters of hostname if first five are alphabets and the string has no special characters or spaces.

hostname_prefix_country_iso.caption: Hostname Prefix Country ISO
hostname_prefix_country_iso.description: Country ISO derived from the first two characters of the Display Label, provided the first five characters are alphabets with no special characters or spaces. This does not necessarily indicate a TP operating country.

strategic_region.caption: Strategic Region
strategic_region.description: Startegic Region Determined from lookup table.

cluster_bu.caption: Cluster BU
cluster_bu.description: Cluster or Business Unit Determined from lookup table.

itop_country.caption: iTOP Country
itop_country.description: Country determined from the iTOP IT Location Code. iTOP Location Code XX, TPS and NA are excluded.

itop_region.caption: iTOP Region
itop_region.description: Region determined from the iTOP IT Location Code. iTOP Location Code XX, TPS and NA are excluded.

is_valid_hostname_country_code.caption: Hostname contains Country Code
is_valid_hostname_country_code.description: Indicates whether hostname contains valid country code.

display_label_category.caption: Display Label Category
display_label_category.description: Categorizing display labels as IP Addresses, MAC Addresses, Serial Numbers, Azure AD Device ID, Identifiers, and others.

derived_type.caption: Derived Type
derived_type.description: Type determined from type, hostname_type and display label category.

hostname_contains_type.caption: Hostname contains Type
hostname_contains_type.description: Indicates whether hostname contains host type.

zero_life.caption: Zero Life
zero_life.description: Indicates whether the host is a zero life device.

ad_group.caption: AD Groups
ad_group.description: The distinguishedName of any Active Directory groups the computer is explicitly a member of
